revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - The new reading is good and I agree with the Coptic alt (see previous comments).

Vote - AcceptText - The Coptic letters are correct, and alpha (instead of delta) in l. 5 is reasonable when one considers the shape of that letter in l. 8, especially the long extension stroke, a trace of which is visible to the right of the gap in l. 5. The |alt| tags with language shift indication strike me as a reasonable solution but I would prefer another voter concur on that. In l. 12 I prefer nu to omicron and agree that it should be left undisturbed.

Submit - Entered Coptic letters missed at entry: lin4 ÎšÏ‰Ì£Î±Î¯Î¿Ï… => ÎšÏ‰Ï«Î¹Î¿Ï…, lin7 Î á¿³Î·Ì£ÏÌ£Îµ => Î Ï£Î·Ì£ÏÌ£Îµ. In the later case I added a Coptic |alt|, as â²¡Ï£â²â²£â²‰ is a perfect Coptic word (without dots â€” reading clear). Added a minor PN correction to lin5. (In lin12 Î¿Ì£Ï› may be better than Î½Ì£Ï› but Iâ€™ve left it undisturbed.)
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek; tagged num rend=fraction
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
